Package uno.anahata.asi.model.tool

Class AbstractToolCall<T extends AbstractTool<?,?>,R extends AbstractToolResponse<?>>

java.lang.Object
uno.anahata.asi.model.core.AbstractPart
uno.anahata.asi.model.tool.AbstractToolCall<T,R>
Type Parameters:
T - The specific type of the Tool.
R - The specific type of the Response.
All Implemented Interfaces:
PropertyChangeSource, ThoughtSignature
Direct Known Subclasses:
BadToolCall, JavaMethodToolCall
public abstract class AbstractToolCall<T extends AbstractTool<?,?>,R extends AbstractToolResponse<?>> extends AbstractPart implements ThoughtSignature
Represents a request to execute a specific tool. It holds a direct reference to the tool's definition and its corresponding response.
Author:
anahata-gemini-pro-2.5

    • createResponse

      protected abstract R createResponse(AbstractToolMessage toolMessage)
      Creates the corresponding response object for this tool call. This acts as a factory method and is called once by the constructor.
      Returns:
      A new, un-executed tool response.

    • getDefaultTurnsToKeep

      protected int getDefaultTurnsToKeep()
      Description copied from class: AbstractPart
      Template method hook for subclasses to provide their specific default retention policy. This is the fallback value used when no explicit turnsToKeep is set on the instance.
      Specified by:
      getDefaultTurnsToKeep in class AbstractPart
      Returns:
      The default number of turns for this part type.

    • isEffectivelyPruned

      public boolean isEffectivelyPruned()
      Description copied from class: AbstractPart
      Calculates the EFFECTIVE pruned state of this part, now with "deep pinning" logic. A part is effectively pruned if it was explicitly pruned, if its PARENT MESSAGE was explicitly pruned, or if its time-to-live has expired. Crucially, it is considered NOT pruned if it or its parent message is "pinned" (pruned=false).
      Overrides:
      isEffectivelyPruned in class AbstractPart
      Returns:
      true if the part is effectively pruned, false otherwise.

    • getTurnsLeft

      public int getTurnsLeft()
      Description copied from class: AbstractPart
      Calculates the remaining turns before this part is auto-pruned.
      Overrides:
      getTurnsLeft in class AbstractPart
      Returns:
      The number of turns left, or a large positive number for indefinite retention.

    • setPruned

      public void setPruned(Boolean pruned)
      Description copied from class: AbstractPart
      Sets the pruned state of this part and fires a property change event.
      Overrides:
      setPruned in class AbstractPart
      Parameters:
      pruned - The new pruned state.
